text.17_Chapter, 16_Verse: He sent his prophets, [he who is] a mighty king who reigns in strength;84+ on high he took me [and] delivered me from many Gentiles.
text.17_Chapter, 17_Verse: He delivered me from my enemies, for they are strong; from my foes, for they prevailed against me.
text.17_Chapter, 18_Verse: They confronted me in the day of my wandering; but the word of the LORD was my support.
text.17_Chapter, 19_Verse: And he brought me out to a broad place, he delivered me because he was pleased with me.85+ said David
text.17_Chapter, 20_Verse: The LORD will requite me86repay me according to my merit; according to the cleanness of my hands he will answer me.
text.17_Chapter, 21_Verse: For I have kept the proper ways in the LORD’s presence; and I have not walked in evil before the LORD.87my God
text.17_Chapter, 22_Verse: For all his judgments are revealed in my sight, to do them; and his covenants I will not remove88or, he has not removed from me.
text.17_Chapter, 23_Verse: And I was89I will be blameless in fear of him; and I kept my soul from sins.
text.17_Chapter, 24_Verse: And the LORD rewarded me according to my merit; according to the cleanness of my hands in the presence of his word.
text.17_Chapter, 25_Verse: With Abraham, who was found pious in your presence, you showed much mercy; with his seed, Isaac, who was complete in fear of you, you completed your favorable word.90cp. Vayiqra Rabba 11:5
text.17_Chapter, 26_Verse: With Jacob, who was pure91walked in purity in your presence, you chose his sons from all the Gentiles, and separated his seed from all that is unfit; but with Pharaoh and his seed, and the Egyptians who thought evil thoughts against your people92+ Israel, you confounded them in their thoughts.
text.17_Chapter, 27_Verse: Because you are going to redeem the people, the house of Israel, who are esteemed93needy among the peoples in exile; and by your word you will abase the mighty nations who prevail over them.
text.17_Chapter, 28_Verse: For you will light the lamp of Israel that was extinguished in the exile, for you are the lord of the light of Israel. The LORD my God will bring me out of darkness into light94+ and shine before me; he will show me his eternal consolation which is to come to the righteous.
text.17_Chapter, 29_Verse: For by your word I will pass through armies; and by the word of my God I will subdue mighty citadels.
text.17_Chapter, 30_Verse: God [is he] whose ways are true; the Torah of the LORD is pure; he is a shield to all who trust in him.95his word
text.17_Chapter, 31_Verse: For because of the miracle and deliverance that you will perform for your Messiah, and for the remnants of your people who will remain, all the Gentiles, nations, and tongues will confess and say, There is no God but the LORD, for there is none besides you; and your people96 + the house of Israel will say, There is none mighty except our God.
text.17_Chapter, 32_Verse: God, who girds on me a belt in strength, and makes blameless my way.
text.17_Chapter, 33_Verse: Who makes my feet97+ swift like hinds’; and he will sustain me in my stronghold.
text.17_Chapter, 34_Verse: Who teaches my hands to do battle, and who makes my arms as strong as a bronze bow.
text.17_Chapter, 35_Verse: And you have given me strength and redemption; and your right hand will help me; and by your word you have multiplied me.
text.17_Chapter, 36_Verse: You have broadened98multiplied my steps in my place, and my knee has not buckled.
text.17_Chapter, 37_Verse: I will pursue my enemies; [now] have I destroyed them, and I did not return until I finished them off.99 and I will overtake them, and not return until I have finished them off. (The first targum assimilates the text to 2 Sam. 22:38; the second reflects the text of the psalm.)
text.17_Chapter, 38_Verse: I will destroy them,100 An assimilation to 2 Sam. 22:39 and they are unable to rise; and the slain have fallen under the soles of my feet.
text.17_Chapter, 39_Verse: And you have girded me with strength as a belt to do battle; you have defeated beneath me the Gentiles who rise up to do me harm.
text.17_Chapter, 40_Verse: And my foes you have broken in my presence; you have made them turn tail; [thus] my enemies I will destroy.
text.17_Chapter, 41_Verse: They seek help, but they have no redeemer; they pray in the presence of the LORD, but he does not accept their prayer.
text.17_Chapter, 42_Verse: I have crushed101trampled them like clods of earth before the storm-wind; and like the mud of the streets I have trodden them.
text.17_Chapter, 43_Verse: You will deliver me from the discords of the Gentiles; you will keep me102you have appointed me by my destiny a benefactor at the head of the Gentiles; a people that I did not know shall worship me.
text.17_Chapter, 44_Verse: At the hearing of the ear, they will obey me; the sons of the peoples103foreign peoples will desert in my presence.
text.17_Chapter, 45_Verse: The sons of the peoples103see above above will perish, and will go into exile from their palaces.
text.17_Chapter, 46_Verse: The LORD lives, and blessed is the mighty one; for from his presence strength and redemption are given to me; and exalted is God, the strength of my redemption.
text.17_Chapter, 47_Verse: It is God who works retribution for me, and defeats beneath me the Gentiles who arise to do me harm.
text.17_Chapter, 48_Verse: He delivers104redeems me from my foes; indeed against those who arise to do me harm you will make me prevail; you will deliver me from Gog and the armies of rapacious Gentiles with him.
text.17_Chapter, 49_Verse: Because of this, I will give praise in your presence among the Gentiles, O LORD; and I will sing praises to your name.
text.17_Chapter, 50_Verse: He works abundant redemption with his king, and shows favor to his anointed, to David and his seed forever.
text.23_Chapter, 0_Verse: Of David, a praise. Adonai's is — behold — the earth and it creatures, the land and those that dwell on it,
text.23_Chapter, 1_Verse: on account that he spaced its foundation on the seas, and on the rivers established it.
text.23_Chapter, 2_Verse: Who will ascend to the mountain of the Holy Temple of Adonai, and who will stand in the place of holinesses?
text.23_Chapter, 3_Verse: The pure of hand and clear of thought, who never swear on falsehood and forfeit their lives, nor vow to deceptiveness.
text.23_Chapter, 4_Verse: He will recieve blessing from before Adonai, and righteousness from the God who saves him.
text.23_Chapter, 5_Verse: This is the generation that will seek him out, that seeks out the good countenance of Jacob forever.
text.23_Chapter, 6_Verse: Lift up, gates of the Holy Temple, your heads, and be lifted up, eternal entrances, and the Honored King will enter.
text.23_Chapter, 7_Verse: Who is he, that Honored King? Adonai, strong and powerful; Adonai, master of power who does war.
text.23_Chapter, 8_Verse: Lift up, gates of the Garden of Eden, your heads, and be lifted up, eternal entrances, and the Honored King will enter.
text.23_Chapter, 9_Verse: Who is he, that Honored King? Adonai Tsevaot is the Honored King eternally.
text.89_Chapter, 0_Verse: The prayer that Moses the prophet of the LORD prayed when the people, the house of Israel, sinned in the wilderness. He raised his voice and thus he said: O LORD, the dwelling of whose presence is in heaven, you have been for us a helper in every generation.
text.89_Chapter, 1_Verse: When it was manifest in your presence that your people were going to sin, you established repentance; before ever the mountains were lifted up and the earth and the world’s inhabitants created, and from this age to the age to come, you are God.
text.89_Chapter, 2_Verse: You will return a son of man to death because of his sin; and [yet] you have said, “Repent, O sons of men.”
text.89_Chapter, 3_Verse: For a thousand years in your eyes are considered in your presence like a yesterday, for it will pass; and like a watch in the night.
text.89_Chapter, 4_Verse: And if they do not repent, death will come upon them, they will be as those who are sleeping; and in the age to come, they will disappear like crumbling grass.
text.89_Chapter, 5_Verse: Their deeds are like grass that in the morning will spring up and multiply; in the evening it fades and dries up from the heat.
text.89_Chapter, 6_Verse: For we have been destroyed by your harshness, and by your anger1alternate Targum: rage we have been terrified.
text.89_Chapter, 7_Verse: You have set our sins in front of you,the iniquities of our youth before the light of your face.
text.89_Chapter, 8_Verse: For all our days have been removed from your presence in your anger; we have completed the days of our lives like a vapor of the mouth in winter.
text.89_Chapter, 9_Verse: The days of our years in this age are seventy years, quickly passing;2Translation uncertain. and if [one is] in strength, eighty years; but most of them are toil and deceit for the guilty, for they pass in haste and fly away to the morning.3alternate Targum: dust.
text.89_Chapter, 10_Verse: Who is he who knows how to turn back the force of your harshness? – except the righteous, who fear you, appease your anger.
text.89_Chapter, 11_Verse: Who is right to teach us to number our days, except the prophet, whose heart pours forth wisdom?
text.89_Chapter, 12_Verse: Turn, O LORD – how long will you afflict us? – and turn from the harm that you commanded to do to your servants.4alternate Targum: people.
text.89_Chapter, 13_Verse: Satisfy us with your goodness in the age that is likened to a morning, and we will rejoice and be glad in all our days.
text.89_Chapter, 14_Verse: Gladden us like the days that you afflicted us, like the years that we saw harm.
text.89_Chapter, 15_Verse: Let the works of your miracles appear to your servants, and let your splendor be upon their sons.
text.89_Chapter, 16_Verse: And may the pleasantness of the Garden of Eden be upon us from the presence of the LORD our God, and the works of our hands will be established by him.5some manuscripts conclude: and may the works of our hands flourish; he has firmly set the words of Torah upon us.
text.90_Chapter, 0_Verse: He who makes his presence abide in secret is the Most High; he will lodge in the shadow of the clouds of the glory of Shaddai.
text.90_Chapter, 1_Verse: David said: “I will say to the LORD, ‘My confidence and my strong fortress’; my God, I will trust in his word.”
text.90_Chapter, 2_Verse: For he will deliver you, Solomon my son,from the snare and the obstacle, from death and confusion.
text.90_Chapter, 3_Verse: With the shelter of his presence he will shelter you, and you will be confident under the shelter of his glory; his faithfulness is a shield and buckler.
text.90_Chapter, 4_Verse: Be not afraid of the terror of demons who walk at night, of the arrow of the angel of death that he looses during the day;
text.90_Chapter, 5_Verse: Of the death that walks in darkness, of the band of demons that attacks at noon.
text.90_Chapter, 6_Verse: You will invoke the holy name; a thousand will fall at your left side, and ten thousand at your right; they will not come near you to do harm.
text.90_Chapter, 7_Verse: Only with your eyes you will watch, and you will see the wicked as they are destroyed.
text.90_Chapter, 8_Verse: Solomon answered and said: “For you are my confidence, O LORD; in the highest dwelling place you have placed the house of your presence.”
text.90_Chapter, 9_Verse: The lord of the world responded and thus he said: “No harm shall happen to you; and no plague or demon shall come near to your tents.”
text.90_Chapter, 10_Verse: For he will command his angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways.
text.90_Chapter, 11_Verse: They will lift you up by their strength, lest you stumble on the evil impulse, which is likened to the stones at your feet.
text.90_Chapter, 12_Verse: You will trample on6Alternate targum: kickthe lions’ whelp and the adder; you will tread down the lion and the viper.
text.90_Chapter, 13_Verse: Because he has taken pleasure in my word, and I will deliver him; I will exalt him because he knows my name.
text.90_Chapter, 14_Verse: He will pray in my presence and I will answer him; I am with him in distress, I will save him and glorify7Alternate targum: exalt him.
text.90_Chapter, 15_Verse: I will satisfy him with length of days; I will show him my redemption.
text.91_Chapter, 0_Verse: A psalm and song that the first Adam uttered concerning the Sabbath day.
text.91_Chapter, 1_Verse: It is good to give thanks in the presence of the Lord, and to praise your name, O Most High.
text.91_Chapter, 2_Verse: To recount your goodness in the morning, and your truth in the nights,
text.91_Chapter, 3_Verse: According to the harp of ten strings, and according to the lyre, upon the murmuring of harps.
text.91_Chapter, 4_Verse: For you have made me glad, O Lord, by your works; I will rejoice in the works of your hands.
text.91_Chapter, 5_Verse: How great are your works, O Lord; your thoughts are very deep.
text.91_Chapter, 6_Verse: A foolish son of man will not know it, and a fool will not comprehend this.
text.91_Chapter, 7_Verse: While the wicked flourish like grass and all workers of deceit blossom, God is going to destroy them forever.
text.91_Chapter, 8_Verse: But you are high and supreme in this age, O LORD, and you are high and supreme in the age to come.1Another Targum: And you, your hand is supreme to punish the wicked in the age to come, in the great day of judgment, O LORD; and you, your hand is supreme to give a good reward to the righteous in the age to come, O LORD.
text.91_Chapter, 9_Verse: For, behold, your enemies, 2many targumim continue: prosper in this age; O LORD, for behold, your enemies will perish in the age to come; and all the workers of deceit will be separated from the band of the righteous.
text.91_Chapter, 10_Verse: You have raised up my might like a wild-ox; you have anointed me with moist anointing oil of the leafy olive.
text.91_Chapter, 11_Verse: And my eye has looked on the perdition of my oppressors; my ear has heard the sound of the destruction of those who stand against me to do harm.
text.91_Chapter, 12_Verse: The righteous man will grow fruit like the palm-tree, like the cedar in Lebanon he will grow and produce roots.
text.91_Chapter, 13_Verse: His sons will be planted in the sanctuary of the Lord; in the court of the house of our God they will flourish.
text.91_Chapter, 14_Verse: Again like their fathers they will produce sons in old age; they will be plump and juicy.
text.91_Chapter, 15_Verse: So that the inhabitants of the earth might tell it, for the Lord is upright; my strength,3many targumim read: mighty one; and there is no wrong in him.
text.103_Chapter, 0_Verse: Bless, O my soul, the name of the LORD. O LORD my God, you are greatly exalted; you have put on praise and splendor.
text.103_Chapter, 1_Verse: Who wraps himself in light like a sheet, who stretches out the heavens like a curtain.
text.103_Chapter, 2_Verse: Who covers his chambers with water like a building with beams; who placed his chariot, as it were, upon swift clouds; who goes on the wings of an eagle.
text.103_Chapter, 3_Verse: Who made his messengers as swift as wind; his servants, as strong as burning fire.
text.103_Chapter, 4_Verse: Who lays the foundation of the earth upon its base, so that it will not shake for ages upon ages.
text.103_Chapter, 5_Verse: You have covered over the abyss as with a garment; and the waters split on the mountains, and endure.
text.103_Chapter, 6_Verse: At your rebuke, they will flee, flowing down; at the sound of your shout, they will be frightened, pouring themselves out.
text.103_Chapter, 7_Verse: They will go up from the abyss to the mountains, and descend to the valleys, to this place that you founded for them.
text.103_Chapter, 8_Verse: You have placed a boundary for the waves of the sea that they will not cross, lest they return to cover the earth.
text.103_Chapter, 9_Verse: Who releases springs into rivers; they flow between the mountains.
text.103_Chapter, 10_Verse: They water all the wild animals; the asses will break their thirst.
text.103_Chapter, 11_Verse: The birds of heaven will settle on them; they will give out a sound of singing from among the branches.
text.103_Chapter, 12_Verse: Who waters the mountains from his upper treasury; the earth will be satisfied with the fruit of your deeds.
text.103_Chapter, 13_Verse: Who makes grass grow for beasts, and herbs for the cultivation of the son of man, that bread may come forth from the earth;
text.103_Chapter, 14_Verse: And wine that gladdens the heart of the son of man, to make the face shine by oil; and bread will support the heart of the son of man.
text.103_Chapter, 15_Verse: The trees that the LORD created are satisfied, the cedars of Lebanon that he planted:
text.103_Chapter, 16_Verse: Where the birds make nests; the stork’s dwelling is in the cypresses.
text.103_Chapter, 17_Verse: The high mountains are for the wild goats; the rocks are security for the conies.
text.103_Chapter, 18_Verse: He made the moon to calculate times by; the sun knows the time of his setting.
text.103_Chapter, 19_Verse: You will make darkness and it will be night; in it all the beasts of the forest creep about.
text.103_Chapter, 20_Verse: The offspring of lions roar to find food, and to seek their sustenance from God.
text.103_Chapter, 21_Verse: The sun will shine, they gather together; and they lay down in their dwelling place.
text.103_Chapter, 22_Verse: A son of man will go forth to his work and to his cultivation, until the sunset of evening.
text.103_Chapter, 23_Verse: How many are your works, O LORD! You have made all of them in wisdom; the earth is full of your possessions.
text.103_Chapter, 24_Verse: This sea is great and broad in extent; creeping things are there without number, both tiny creatures and large.
text.103_Chapter, 25_Verse: There the ships go about, and this Leviathan you created for the sport of the righteous at the supper of his dwelling place.
text.103_Chapter, 26_Verse: All of them rely on you to give their food in its time.
text.103_Chapter, 27_Verse: You will give it to them, and they gather it; you will open your hand, and they are satisfied with goodness.
text.103_Chapter, 28_Verse: You will remove your presence, they are dazed; you will gather their spirit and they expire, and return to their dust.
text.103_Chapter, 29_Verse: You will send out your holy spirit and they are created; and you will make new the surface of the earth.
text.103_Chapter, 30_Verse: May the glory of the LORD be eternal; the LORD will rejoice in his works.
text.103_Chapter, 31_Verse: Who looks at the earth, and it shakes; he draws near to the mountains, and they emit smoke.
text.103_Chapter, 32_Verse: I will sing praise in the presence of the LORD during my life; I will make music to my God while I exist.
text.103_Chapter, 33_Verse: May my talk be pleasing in his presence; I will rejoice in the word of the LORD.
text.103_Chapter, 34_Verse: The sinners will be destroyed from the earth, and wicked exist no longer. Bless, O my soul, the name of the LORD. Hallelujah!
text.117_Chapter, 21_Verse: The boy the builders rejected; he was among the sons of Jesse and he was privileged to be appointed as king and ruler.
text.117_Chapter, 22_Verse: "This is from YHWH," said the builders; "It is marvelous before us," said the sons of Jesse.
text.117_Chapter, 23_Verse: "This is the day YHWH made [or acted]," said the builders; "Let us rejoice and be glad in it," said the sons of Jesse.
text.117_Chapter, 24_Verse: "Please, from you, O YHWH, now!" said the builders; "Please, from you, O YHWH, cause [us] to prosper, now!" said Jesse and his wife.
text.117_Chapter, 25_Verse: "Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the word of YHWH," said [the] builders; "They bless you from the house of the sanctuary of YHWH," said David.
text.117_Chapter, 26_Verse: "YHWH is God; he caused [light] to shine for us," said the tribes of the house of Judah; "Bind the lamb for the sacrifice of the feast with ropes until you offer him and you sprinkle his blood on the horns of the altar," said Samuel the prophet.
text.119_Chapter, 0_Verse: The song that is said on the ascents from the abyss. Before Adonai, when I was distressed, I prayed, and He received my prayer.
text.119_Chapter, 1_Verse: Adonai saves my soul from the lips of falsehood, from the deceitful tongue.
text.119_Chapter, 2_Verse: What will it give you, badmouther, and what benefit to you, informant, is the deceitful tongue?
text.119_Chapter, 3_Verse: Sharp arrows of a warrior, like lightning above, with coals of broom wood that burn in hell below.
text.119_Chapter, 4_Verse: Woe is me, since I am made to live with the Asians, to dwell in the tents of the Arabs!
text.119_Chapter, 5_Verse: Too long has my soul lived with Edom, hater of peace.
text.119_Chapter, 6_Verse: I am peace, and since I pray they go to war.
text.120_Chapter, 0_Verse: The song that is said on the ascents from the abyss. I raise up my eyes to the mountains — from where comes my help?
text.120_Chapter, 1_Verse: My help is from before Adonai, who made the heaven and earth.
text.120_Chapter, 2_Verse: He will not make your feet totter, unsleeping is your Guardian.
text.120_Chapter, 3_Verse: Behold — unsleeping and unresting is the guardian of Israel.
text.120_Chapter, 4_Verse: Adonai will guard you. Adonai will cast shade upon you on account of the mezuzah that is affixed to the right side of your entrance.
text.120_Chapter, 5_Verse: In the day, when the sun rules, the zephyrs will not strike you; nor the lilin, when the moon rules in the night.
text.120_Chapter, 6_Verse: The word of Adonai will guard you from all evil, will guard your soul.
text.120_Chapter, 7_Verse: Adonai will guard your going out to business and your going in to engage in Torah from now and until forever.
text.121_Chapter, 0_Verse: The song that is said on the ascents from the abyss. I rejoiced when they were saying to me, "To the Holy Temple of Adonai let us go!"
text.121_Chapter, 1_Verse: Our feet were standing in your gates, Jerusalem!
text.121_Chapter, 2_Verse: Jerusalem that is built in the firmament is like the city that is joined with it as one on earth.
text.121_Chapter, 3_Verse: That there went up the tribes, tribes of Adonai, testifying to Israel that His Presence dwells among them, to make them go to thank the name of Adonai.
text.121_Chapter, 4_Verse: Because there were installed thrones in Jerusalem: thrones in the Holy Temple of the kings of the house of David.
text.121_Chapter, 5_Verse: Ask peace for Jerusalem, may those who love you dwell in security.
text.121_Chapter, 6_Verse: May there be peace in your walls, security in your citadels.
text.121_Chapter, 7_Verse: On account of my brothers and by friends, I will speak now of peace in you.
text.121_Chapter, 8_Verse: For the temple of Adonai our God, I seek good for you.
text.122_Chapter, 0_Verse: The song that is said on the ascents from the abyss. Before You I lift my eyes — You who are seated on a glorious throne in heaven.
text.122_Chapter, 1_Verse: Behold, just as slaves' eyes gaze at the leftovers from their owners' hands, and just as maids' eyes gaze at the leftovers from their mistresses' hands, so too our eyes gaze at before Adonai our God, until when He has mercy on us.
text.122_Chapter, 2_Verse: Have mercy on us, Adonai, have mercy on us, because we are exceedingly sated with contempt.
text.122_Chapter, 3_Verse: So much, our souls are sated with ridicule from those living at ease, the haughty and proud!
